Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired brown) with traces of two added white bands near bottom of foot; reserved edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The foot of some Mature Animal Style chalices is decorated with concentric added white bands. for parallels, see Lemos nos. 674 and 676 from Pitane. The foot of some Grand Style chalices is decorated with concentric white bands. For parallels, see Lemos no. 800 from Pitane. For parallels regarding Chalice Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Histria. For parallels regarding Black Figure Komast chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos nos. 1562 and 1564 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0705) (phase 2)
